sect1.sect2:
Introduction to Kde-workspace
The Kde-workspace package contains components that are central to providing the KDE4 desktop environment. Of particular importance are KWin, the KDE4 window manager, and Plasma, which provides the workspace interface.

sect2.title: Installation of Kde-workspace
sect2.para: Install Kde4-workspace by running the following commands:

screen.userinput: mkdir build && cd build && cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$KDE4_PREFIX \ -DKDE_DEFAULT_HOME=.kde4 \ -DSYSCONF_INSTALL_DIR=/etc/kde4 \ .. && make

sect2.title: Starting KDE4
sect2.para: After Kde-workspace has finished, the first important milestone has been reached. Now you can start KDE4. Modify your .xinitrc:

screen.userinput:
cat > ~/.xinitrc <<EOF # Begin .xinitrc file #setxkbmap -layout de -model pc105 -variant nodeadkeys setxkbmap -layout de -model pc105 # ## Start TWM #xterm -g 80x40+0+0 & #xclock -g 100x100-0+0 & #twm
# Start KDE exec dbus-launch --exit-with-session startkde #startkde EOF

sect2.para: Tweak this file to match your needs, especially setting the keyboard layout if you do not have a /etc/X11/xorg.conf. If you are using ConsoleKit, add ck-launch-session before dbus-launch. Every subsequent package can be built while having KDE4 up and running, but remember to keep &kde4-dir; and $QT4DIR set.
